intro: Achyrospermum nyasanum, commonly known as the African sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers and palmate leaves. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in open areas or along roadsides. Its botanical features make it a popular ornamental plant in gardens and landscapes.
